content.question: Let <math alttext="M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the region in the first quadrant bounded by the graphs of <math alttext="y equals, arc tangent x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>arctan</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y equals, the fraction, pi over 4, end fraction, times x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, as shown in the figure above. What is the volume of the solid generated when region <math alttext="M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is revolved around the vertical line <math alttext="x equals 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

topic.text: 8.12: Volume with Washer Method - Revolving Around Other Axes

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
